main.commit_message:
Update README.md with latest usage information

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Extend maximum DNS name to 255

The hostname part is still restricted to 63 characters

See RFC 1035, section 2.3.4

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Update spec

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Updating version to 3.0.5

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

release.sh: Add dry-run

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

release.sh: Update with automatic version

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Reformat meson.build

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Initialize as a source-git repository

From-dist-git-commit: f673a25e514983ab0fafc5c5f1c603e33682f694

Drop s390x tests

They are broken due to emulation issues.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Automate more of packit

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Use explicit 'meson setup'

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Extend timeout for non-x86 tests

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Debian: Build with DWARF-v4 for clang

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Debian: Disable LTO on clang

When compiling with clang, this breaks due to lack of support for
-ffat-lto-objects.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Work around 'dubious ownership' github issue

See: https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/1169

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

packit: fix files_to_sync

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Initialize as a source-git repository

From-dist-git-commit: fbcc49819f3e4303ceea04d79f041b0cb7ce2fa4

Drop unused Changelog file

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Update packit configuration

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Correct license headers

The various license notices in the project were incomplete and therefore
ambiguous. This patch does not CHANGE any licenses, merely clarifies
them.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Revert "Extend maximum hostname to 255"

This reverts commit 1acc527400bc42c4d370b71cec340bf1ce3ebcaf.

Extend maximum hostname to 255

See RFC 1035, section 2.3.4

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Release SSCG 3.0.3

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Code auto-formatting

Signed-off-by: sscg CI <github-actions@github.com>

clang format

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Fix errors detecting dhparams file creation failure

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Always create debug CSR files in /tmp

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Allow skipping dhparams file creation

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Allow dhparams at the end of certificate files

Se: rfc4346 for details

Fixes: https://github.com/sgallagher/sscg/issues/66

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

CI: Drop Ubuntu 18.04

https://github.blog/changelog/2022-07-20-github-actions-the-macos-10-15-actions-runner-image-is-being-deprecated-and-will-be-removed-by-8-30-22/

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

CI: Add Ubuntu 22.04 to the test matrix

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Track the latest run-on-arch action

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Update Github checkout action to v3

Also update add-and-commit action to v9.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

dhparams: don't fail if default file can't be created

Resolves: rhbz#2143206

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Add tests for cert validity and key strength

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Debian packaging: Bump Standards-Version to 4.6.1

No changes necessary:
https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/upgrading-checklist.html#version-4-6-1

Increase create_csr_test unit test timeout

30 seconds is often not enough on slow/emulated architectures like
riscv64.

https://bugs.debian.org/1014259

Add CentOS Stream 9 to Packit jobs

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Initialize as a source-git repository

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Drop epel-8 from COPR targets

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Truncate IP address in SAN

In OpenSSL 1.1, this was done automatically when addind a SAN extension,
but in OpenSSL 3.0 it is rejected as an invalid input.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Fix incorrect error-check

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Get Fedora container images from Quay.io

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Packit: Drop redundant epel-8 build

It was duplicating the work of the centos-stream-8 build

Fix another negative bitshift issue

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Protect against negative bitshift

Coverity scan identified that SSCG_FILE_TYPE_UNKNOWN could cause the
bitshifts further down to attempt to shift a negative number, which
results in undefined behavior. Though it should never occur that this
function is called with an invalid type, it's best to be overly
cautious and check for it.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Switch Coverity scan to CentOS Stream 8

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

CI: Drop CentOS Linux, long live CentOS Stream!

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>

Debian packaging: Drop obsolete popt paragraph

popt got removed in commit 69bc3844de9b2b

Fix release script

Signed-off-by: Stephen Gallagher <sgallagh@redhat.com>
